oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development of "Blossom-Protect" - a yeast preparation for the reduction of blossom infections by fire blight
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kunz, Stefan
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In organic apple-growing control agents are necessary to prevent the blossoms being infected by the fire blight pathogen Erwinia amylovora. Detached apple blossoms were used as an experimental model to develop preparations based on yeast isolates for use in the control of fire blight. Several yeast isolates reduced disease incidence in apple blossoms. The efficiency of yeast isolates was increased by developing a suitable formulation. This yeast preparation exhibited high efficiency in the control of fire blight in field-trials and will be marketed under the tradename "Blossom- Protect".
